tweet:
Today, I honored the memory of Senator Richard Lugar on the Senate floor, where he spent decades dedicating his life to serving Hoosiers. 

I told the story of the first time I met Dick, and how it still inspires me today. pic.twitter.com/RO5otdf7Jc

It’s an honor to work for Hoosiers from the seat and the same desk on the Senate floor as Senator @DickLugar: a constant reminder that integrity and character matter. 

I’ll be speaking on the @SenateFloor with @SenToddYoung about Lugar‘s legacy today at 11:30. pic.twitter.com/cz3855J394

As a business owner I know first-hand we have a workforce skills gap. This legislation with @RepJimBanks will address that crisis, improve job placement, and reduce student debt by prioritizing skills-based programs.

 https://tinyurl.com/yxsp9vvl

That’s me on the right when I volunteered for the ‘Youth for Lugar’ campaign in college. I’ve treasured this photo and his kind words since. 

“Good luck to Mike, a talented and loyal friend - Dick Lugar, June 21, 1974” pic.twitter.com/7ytiVFLT1V
Maureen and I are praying for the Lugar family in this difficult time.

Senator Richard Lugar is a towering figure in Hoosier history and one of the greatest statesmen ever to serve in the U.S. Senate. As our longest serving Senator, he worked tirelessly with leaders across the globe to better the state and the country he loved.
